port.name: port
port.description: port to expose the database on (identifies where the db is listening and maps it to the desired local port, defaults to db default

network.name: network
network.description: docker network to connect db to

name.name: name
name.description: the name to give this database - autogenerates one for you otherwise

env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to pass into the db

username.name: username
username.description: root username for db - defaults to root

password.name: password
password.description: root password for db - defaults to password

data.name: data
data.description: where to store the data in this database — defaults to ./.qudb/data

args.name: database
args.description: type of database to start. If you'd like more, support can be added easily (file an issue!)

args.name: store
args.description: location where to save data - defaults to current directory

ps.description: gets status of the database based on the current directory (or path otherwise specified). otherwise, it displays all docker statuses

args.name: name
args.description: name of database to check the status of

port.name: port
port.description: port to expose the database on (identifies where the db is listening and maps it to the desired local port. defaults to exposing the db on its standard output port

network.name: network
network.description: docker network to connect db to

store.name: store
store.description: location where to save data - defaults to current directory

name.name: name
name.description: the name to give this database - autogenerates one for you otherwise

env.name: env
env.description: environment variables to pass into the db

username.name: username
username.description: root username for db - defaults to root

password.name: password
password.description: root password for db - defaults to password

load.name: load
load.description: directory where your qudb.yaml file is located

data.name: data
data.description: where to store the data in this database — defaults to ./.qudb/data

args.name: database
args.description: type of database to start (postgres | mysql | redis). If you'd like more, support can be added easily (file an issue!)

args.name: store
args.description: location where to load configuration file from
